message.content: We refer to the side effect profiles of the medications listed. Lisinopril, an ACE inhibitor, is known to cause a dry cough in some patients. Aspirin, hydrochlorothiazide, and nifedipine are not typically associated with cough as a side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor commonly used to treat hypertension and diabetes. It can cause a dry, non-productive cough as a side effect. Aspirin and hydrochlorothiazide are not typically associated with this side effect. Nifedipine is a calcium channel blocker that may cause a cough, but it is less common than with ACE inhibitors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor that can cause a dry cough as a side effect. Aspirin, hydrochlorothiazide, and nifedipine do not typically cause a dry cough.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor commonly used for hypertension and can cause a dry cough as a common side effect. Aspirin, hydrochlorothiazide, and nifedipine do not typically cause a dry cough as a side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor that can cause a dry cough as a side effect. Aspirin, hydrochlorothiazide, and nifedipine do not typically cause a dry cough.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the medications listed, Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor that commonly causes a dry, nonproductive cough as a side effect. Aspirin, Hydrochlorothiazide, and Nifedipine do not typically cause this symptom.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor commonly used to treat hypertension and heart failure. A dry, non-productive cough is a common side effect of ACE inhibitors, and the patient's medical history indicates that he is taking medications for these conditions.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor commonly used to treat hypertension and heart failure, but it can also cause a dry cough as a side effect. Aspirin, hydrochlorothiazide, and nifedipine do not commonly cause coughing as a side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor commonly associated with a dry cough as a side effect. Aspirin, hydrochlorothiazide, and nifedipine are not typically associated with a dry cough. The patient’s other medical conditions are not likely to cause a dry cough.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, lisinopril is known to cause a dry cough as a side effect. Aspirin can cause gastrointestinal symptoms, hydrochlorothiazide can cause electrolyte imbalances, and nifedipine can cause peripheral edema as side effects, but not dry cough.
